author: @exploreplanets
title: Mars rovers, helicopters, and sunsets
text:
[The Downlink](/the-downlink) • May 24, 2024
Mars rovers, helicopters, and sunsets
Space Snapshot
This giant crater on Mars is eye-catching not only for its size, but its smoothness — a hint that water ice has played a role in its past. When the asteroid that carved out this crater made impact, it likely melted some ice, launching both rock and liquid water out and away. Now, the crater stretches over 8 kilometers (roughly 5 miles) wide. As ESA’s ExoMars Trace Gas Orbiter passed overhead, the spacecraft nearly failed to fit the entire feature inside its field of view. Image credit: ESA/TGO/CaSSIS.
Fact Worth Sharing
Though Mars is known as the red planet, its sunsets are blue. Very fine dust in the Martian atmosphere scatters redder light more effectively, so when the Sun is very low in the sky, red tones tend to get filtered out. This leaves blues more likely to reach someone standing on the surface.
Mission Briefings
ESA and NASA will team up for the next Mars rover. The Rosalind Franklin rover is set to be Europe’s first on Mars, but it has been stalled ever since a collaboration with Russia fell apart following the invasion of Ukraine. Now,
NASA has agreed to pick up the slack by providing launch capabilities and components of the spacecraft’s landing and heating systems. Planned to touch down in 2029, Rosalind Franklin will drill deep into the Martian soil to look for signs of past life. Image credit: ESA.
After 60 years, NASA’s first Black astronaut candidate has finally made it to space. Ed Dwight, an Air Force pilot who was recommended — but passed over — for NASA’s astronaut corps in the 1960s,
reached space at last as a passenger on a private mission instead. Blue Origin’s New Shephard spacecraft took Dwight and five others on the suborbital flight. Along the way, Dwight broke William Shatner’s record as the oldest person ever to visit space.
India’s next Mars mission could feature a helicopter. Officials from the country’s space agency have revealed that Mangalyaan-2 will not only aim to land on Mars, but also
deploy a rover and a helicopter. This combination echoes NASA’s Mars 2020 mission, which brought both the Perseverance rover and the Ingenuity helicopter to the red planet. Mangalyaan-2 currently lacks a launch date, but if successful, the mission would make India the fourth country to ever soft-land on Mars.
The Artemis Accords have expanded to 40 countries. First established in 2020,
the statement of principles regarding space exploration has rapidly been taken up by a broad coalition of international partners.
From The Planetary Society
Battle bots cause more than just mayhem. They also inspire new generations of roboticists and encourage them to pursue their dreams of working on projects like space missions. On
this week’s Planetary Radio, hear from Kelly Biderman, the CEO of Havoc Robotics, about how the National Havoc Robot League provides community and support for those who want to help explore the Universe. Florence Pouya, the former captain of the Afghan Girls Robotics Team, joins in to share her perspective with our senior communications adviser, Mat Kaplan. Pictured: Battle at a National Havoc Robot League competition. Image credit: Havoc Robotics.
Did you know Earth has quasi-moons and minimoons? Our planet may only have one true natural satellite — the Moon — but our neighborhood is also full of smaller bodies, some with unusual orbits. We’re only just beginning to uncover what
these pseudo-moons have to teach us. The first mission to a quasi-moon, China’s Tianwen-2, is set to launch next year.
New in the member community
Planetary People kicks off. To inaugurate our new series in the member community, host Mat Kaplan
interviewed Garry Hunt, former NASA scientist and co-host of BBC’s The Sky at Night. Hunt shared memories of his time working on the Viking and Voyager missions, offered his thoughts on the recent layoffs at JPL, and described how he recently came to be knighted by King Charles. []https://www.planetary.org/video/planetary-people-live-qa-with-garry-hunt
What's Up
In the predawn east, look for Mercury low to the east, with yellowish Saturn and reddish Mars above it.
Learn more about what May’s night skies have in store.
Wow of the Week
As NASA’s Juno spacecraft flew by Jupiter, it took these images of the planet’s fifth largest moon, Amalthea. On the left, Amalthea is caught perfectly in the foreground of Jupiter’s Great Red Spot, while on the right, the moon is closer to the bottom-center of the planet. Image credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech/SwRI/MSSS; image processing by Gerald Echstädt.

title: Befana movimentata, pioggia, vento e neve in arrivo
text:
Befana movimentata, pioggia, vento e neve in arrivo
Articolo Precedente
Articolo Successivo
La Befana di quest'anno si preannuncia decisamente movimentata. Lunedì 6 gennaio, infatti, l'arrivo di masse d'aria di origine polare provocherà un drastico cambiamento meteorologico. Queste correnti freddissime, dopo aver attraversato il bacino del Mediterraneo, daranno origine a un profondo ciclone che porterà maltempo su gran parte del Nord Italia. Le regioni settentrionali saranno interessate da piogge diffuse, ma non solo: sono attese anche nevicate a partire dagli 800-900 metri di quota su Alpi e Prealpi.
Le previsioni indicano che, a partire da questa data, il meteo subirà un cambiamento significativo, con l'arrivo di freddo intenso e nevicate a bassa quota. Alcuni scenari suggeriscono che il freddo potrebbe fare un ingresso deciso, portando con sé temperature rigide e nevicate anche in pianura. Altri, invece, indicano il possibile ritorno dell'Anticiclone, che potrebbe riportare stabilità atmosferica e condizioni più miti.
Tra l'Epifania e martedì, il maltempo continuerà a imperversare, con piogge, neve e vento che colpiranno diverse regioni. La seconda perturbazione del 2025 sarà guidata da una vasta area depressionaria che si estenderà dall'Atlantico fino alla Penisola Iberica, avanzando verso il Mediterraneo centrale entro l'Epifania. Questo fronte perturbato porterà neve al Nord e piogge sulle regioni centrali tirreniche.
Secondo le previsioni di Antonio Sanò, fondatore del sito 'iLMeteo.

author: Diana Serrano
title: El Ayuntamiento de Zamora transforma una parcela de aparcamiento "residual" en una zona ajardinada al lado de Valorio
text:
El Ayuntamiento de Zamora ha llevado a cabo la creación de nuevas zonas ajardinadas y la próxima forestación de la parcela junto al bosque de Valorio, en la Lobata. El concejal de Obras, Movilidad, Infraestructuras y Participación Ciudadana, Pablo Novo, ha explicado que la parcela de más de 1.800 metros cuadrados, ubicada junto al bosque de Valorio, se encontraba anteriormente sin uso municipal y era utilizada únicamente como aparcamiento "residual" para una media decena de coches.
Gracias a la intervención del Ayuntamiento, este espacio ha sido transformado en una amplia zona ajardinada, equipada con un mirador que ofrece vistas al bosque, un sistema de riego automatizado, una talanquera para proteger el desnivel, tres mesas de madera y dos papeleras.
Hace unos meses, el Ayuntamiento procedió también al ajardinamiento del parterre contiguo a los bloques de viviendas, que antes solo contenía maleza. Se ha sembrado césped y se han plantado rosales y varios árboles, mejorando así el acceso a la guardería municipal de La Lobata. Esta intervención se suma a la reciente creación de la zona estancial en el entorno de la Ermita de la Peña de Francia, con la que el Ayuntamiento sigue avanzando en su objetivo de "ganar espacios públicos de convivencia para todos los vecinos de la ciudad".
El concejal de Obras ha anunciado que, en las próximas campañas de plantación, se procederá a una forestación con diversas especies autóctonas en la parcela colindante con el bosque de Valorio. El objetivo es integrar esta área en la ciudad a través del barrio de San José Obrero. Esta iniciativa forma parte del programa municipal de Naturaliza, que contempla la ejecución de decenas de intervenciones en diversos puntos de la ciudad.
Además, se ha ajardinado el entorno de la calle Valdeperdices y del Paseo de las Vistillas, instalando riego por aspersión y sembrando césped. Novo ha destacado que se ha "dignificado" todo un entorno frecuentado por vecinos y niños que acuden a las instalaciones deportivas o al propio bosque de Valorio. También se ha mejorado la zona de estacionamiento, configurándola con grava machacada y delimitándola con una talanquera de madera para proteger el desnivel.
Francisco Guarido y Pablo Novo, en la zona de La Lobata
También ha anunciado que, en las próximas semanas, se iniciará el ajardinamiento de dos parterres ubicados entre las calles Amor de Dios y Tejares en el barrio de Pinilla, para lo cual ya se ha adjudicado el contrato. Asimismo, los servicios técnicos de infraestructuras están trabajando en la memoria valorada de ajardinamiento de la calle Pericuto en San Isidro.
Por último, Novo ha recordado que continúan los trabajos de desbroce en el entorno de la tradicional fuente de Rabiche. Estos trabajos, ejecutados por la Fundación Secretariado Gitano y financiados por el programa Tándem del SEPE, han contado con la colaboración técnica del Ayuntamiento. Una vez eliminadas las zarzas, se ha iniciado la restauración de la fuente y su peculiar estructura artística, consolidando el área como una zona estancial y poniendo en valor tanto el espacio como el patrimonio histórico y artístico de la fuente.

title: 中央气象台发布暴雨黄色预警--经济·科技--人民网
text:
中央气象台发布暴雨黄色预警
2025年05月08日08:41 | 来源：
人民网
小字号
人民网北京5月8日电 （记者杨虞波罗）中央气象台预计，5月8日08时至9日08时，江淮大部、江汉东部、江南西南部和中东部、华南北部以及华北东北部等地部分地区有大到暴雨，其中，安徽西南部、湖北东部、江西东北部、浙江西部、广西北部等地部分地区有大暴雨（100-180毫米）。上述部分地区伴有短时强降水（最大小时降雨量30-60毫米，局地可超过80毫米），局地有雷暴大风冰雹等强对流天气。
防御指南：
1、政府及相关部门按照职责做好防暴雨工作；
2、交通管理部门应当根据路况在强降雨路段采取交通管制措施，在积水路段实行交通引导；
3、切断低洼地带有危险的室外电源，暂停在空旷地方的户外作业，转移危险地带人员和危房居民到安全场所避雨；
4、检查城市、农田、鱼塘排水系统，采取必要的排涝措施。
(责编：杨虞波罗、吕骞)
